answerText: Hartree-Fock approximation [or self-consistent field method][10] The Hartree-Fock approximation can be used to approximately construct the wavefunctions of these entities, which are written with a star if they are antibonding, and can also be computed in the LCAO method.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2015 | VCU A + Dorman HS  | 18 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This technique approximates a single N-body wavefunction by a Slater determinant. For 10 points each: [10] Name this approximate technique in computational chemistry that computes the ground-state energy for many-body systems by writing the electronic wavefunction as a sum of products of single-particle wavefunctions.
